meta.videoTitle: How to Improve Oral Health & Its Critical Role in Brain & Body Health

paragraphList.text_en: When considering the use of mouthwash in oral hygiene practices, it is vital to be informed about the potential impact that different types of mouthwashes can have on oral health. The text explores the two main categories of mouthwashes: those containing alcohol and antiseptic mouthwashes. It is highlighted that mouthwashes containing alcohol can be detrimental to oral health as they deplete certain components of the mucosal lining of the mouth and disrupt the healthy components of the oral microbiome. This information serves as a reminder to individuals who rely on alcohol-based mouthwashes to reconsider their usage and evaluate whether these products are truly beneficial to their oral health.
paragraphList.text_zh: 当考虑在口腔卫生实践中使用漱口水时，了解不同类型的漱口水对口腔健康的潜在影响至关重要。本文探讨了漱口水的两大类：含酒精漱口水和防腐漱口水。值得强调的是，含有酒精的漱口水会消耗口腔粘膜的某些成分，破坏口腔微生物组的健康成分，从而对口腔健康有害。这些信息提醒那些依赖酒精类漱口水的人重新考虑他们的使用，并评估这些产品是否真的对他们的口腔健康有益。

paragraphList.text_en: Furthermore, the text addresses the usage of antiseptic mouthwashes, which are sometimes prescribed for serious bacterial overgrowth and infections in the oral cavity. While it is acknowledged that certain circumstances may warrant the use of such mouthwashes under professional guidance, there is a cautionary note regarding their potential effects on other components of oral health or the gut microbiota. It is important for individuals to consult with their healthcare professionals to understand the implications of using these types of mouthwashes and to balance the need for controlling bacterial infections with maintaining overall oral and gut health.
paragraphList.text_zh: 此外，该文本还介绍了防腐漱口水的使用，这种漱口水有时用于治疗口腔中严重的细菌过度生长和感染。虽然人们承认，某些情况下可能需要在专业指导下使用此类漱口水，但有一点值得注意，即它们对口腔健康的其他成分或肠道微生物群的潜在影响。重要的是，个人应咨询其医疗保健专业人员，以了解使用这些类型漱口水的影响，并在控制细菌感染与保持口腔和肠道整体健康之间取得平衡。

paragraphList.text_en: For individuals seeking to freshen their breath and reduce oral bacteria through the use of mouthwash, the text suggests exploring alternative options that are not alcohol-based or overly antiseptic. By opting for mouthwashes that do not contain alcohol or that have a milder antiseptic formulation, individuals may be able to achieve their desired outcomes without compromising the health of the oral microbiome. The text mentions the availability of non-alcohol-based mouthwashes as a viable alternative for those who wish to incorporate mouthwash into their oral care routine without the potential risks associated with alcohol-containing products.
paragraphList.text_zh: 对于那些试图通过使用漱口水来清新口气和减少口腔细菌的人，本文建议探索不含酒精或过度防腐的替代选择。通过选择不含酒精或防腐剂配方较温和的漱口水，个人可能能够在不损害口腔微生物组健康的情况下达到预期效果。该文本提到，对于那些希望将漱口水纳入口腔护理常规而不存在与含酒精产品相关的潜在风险的人来说，非酒精漱口水是一种可行的替代品。

paragraphList.text_en: In conclusion, the text underscores the importance of being mindful of the type of mouthwash used in oral hygiene practices. By educating oneself about the potential effects of alcohol-based and antiseptic mouthwashes on oral health, individuals can make informed decisions that align with their oral care needs and overall well-being. Exploring alternative mouthwash options that prioritize oral health while still addressing breath freshness and bacteria control can contribute to a holistic approach to oral hygiene.
paragraphList.text_zh: 最后，本文强调了注意口腔卫生实践中使用的漱口水类型的重要性。通过自学含酒精和防腐漱口水对口腔健康的潜在影响，个人可以根据自己的口腔护理需求和整体健康状况做出明智的决定。探索替代漱口水的选择，优先考虑口腔健康，同时仍然解决呼吸新鲜度和细菌控制问题，有助于口腔卫生的整体方法。
